title: Bachelorette Angie Kent will be left 'devastated' when 'three stars walk out'
text:
Bachelorette Angie Kent has already had two potential suitors leave her season of the dating show prematurely.

And now reports are suggesting a further three will sensationally walk away from their chance to woo the Gogglebox star in the coming weeks.

According to New Idea, an insider source has claimed some of the men struggled to form a connection with the blonde and chose to end their journey early.

Scroll down for video

SPOILER ALERT: Bachelorette Angie Kent will be left 'devastated' when 'three stars walk out' on the show in the coming weeks

'Some of the boys just weren’t feeling it with her... She wasn’t really many of the boy’s type,' the mystery informant said.

The source went on to reveal that the shock departures will occur in the coming few episodes and even name-dropped who is likely to leave.

They said: 'Adam, Haydn and Scot will either walk out, be asked to leave, or blast Angie.'

If true, this would mark a new record for The Bachelorette Australia, with a total of five stars leaving a season before an official rose ceremony.

During season four, Bachelorette Ali Oetjen had four suitors walked from the competition outside of a rose ceremony.

'She wasn’t really many of the boy’s type': According to New Idea, an insider source has claimed some of the men struggled to form a connection with the blonde and chose to end their journey

Oh no! If the rumours are true, this would mark a new record for The Bachelorette Australia, with a total of five stars leaving a season before an official rose ceremony

Last week, during the second week of the show, Angie had two suitors leave the show during a cocktail party at the mansion.

She was forced to cancel the fourth rose ceremony of the season after Warwick Adams walked out and she asked politician Jess Glasgow to leave.

Warwick stormed out of the group date photo shoot after his co-stars mocked him for being dressed as a chicken, and later slipped out of the cocktail party before Angie arrived in a black hoodie.

'I'm done!' Warwick Adams stormed out of the group date photo shoot after his co-stars mocked him for being dressed as a chicken, and later 'ghosted' Angie at the cocktail party

Time to leave! Angie sent Jess Glasgow (ABOVE) packing for being creepy and inappropriate towards herself and the show's female crew

Later in the episode, Angie sent Jess packing for being creepy and inappropriate towards herself and the show's female crew members.

Jess was filmed making unwanted sexual advances and foul comments towards Angie on the group date, and later to producers and waitresses.

This week Angie appears overjoyed to welcome intruder rescue dog advocate Ryan Anderson, who she already knows.

The Bachelorette continues on Wednesday from 7.30pm on Channel 10
description: Bachelorette Angie Kent has already had two potential suitors leave the dating show prematurely.
authors: Candice Jackson For Daily Mail Australia
